intro: Boechera cobrensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, white flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces distinctive silique fruits that contain several seeds. Boechera cobrensis is also noted for its role in ecological studies due to its genetic diversity and potential for hybridization.
